  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int playerId, String username, ShipBoard myShip, Ship_Colour colour)
      Constructor for the Player class.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The unique identifier for the player.
      username - The username or name associated with the player.
      myShip - The ShipBoard object representing the player's ship.
      colour - The Ship_Colour object representing the color of the player's ship.

  • Method Details

    • isHasLittleDeckInHand

      public boolean isHasLittleDeckInHand()
      Checks if the player currently has a little deck in hand.
      Returns:
      true if the player has a little deck in hand, false otherwise.

    • setHasLittleDeckInHand

      public void setHasLittleDeckInHand(boolean hasLittleDeckInHand)
      Sets the flag indicating whether the player has a little deck in hand.
      Parameters:
      hasLittleDeckInHand - a boolean value where true indicates the player has a little deck in hand, and false indicates the player does not.

    • getLittleDeckInHand

      public Deck getLittleDeckInHand()
      Retrieves the "Little Deck" currently held in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      an instance of Deck representing the player's "Little Deck" in hand, or null if the player does not have a "Little Deck" in hand.

    • setLittleDeckInHand

      public void setLittleDeckInHand(Deck littleDeckInHand)
      Sets the little deck in the player's hand. This method updates the current little deck that the player is holding. It is typically used in scenarios where the player picks a deck, deposits it, or the state of the deck in hand changes. The provided deck may consist of a set of cards that the player interacts with as part of the game's logic.
      Parameters:
      littleDeckInHand - the deck to set as the player's current little deck in hand or null to indicate the absence of a deck in hand.

    • isHasTileInHand

      public boolean isHasTileInHand()
      Checks if the player currently has a tile in their hand.
      Returns:
      true if the player has a tile in hand, false otherwise.

    • setHasTileInHand

      public void setHasTileInHand(boolean hasTileInHand)
      Sets the status indicating whether the player has a tile in hand.
      Parameters:
      hasTileInHand - a boolean value where true means the player has a tile in hand, and false means the player does not have a tile in hand.

    • getTileInHand

      public SpaceShipTile getTileInHand()
      Retrieves the tile currently held by the player.
      Returns:
      the SpaceShipTile object currently in the player's hand, or null if no tile is held.

    • setTileInHand

      public void setTileInHand(SpaceShipTile tileInHand)
      Sets the tile currently in the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      tileInHand - the SpaceShipTile to be set as the tile in hand

    • Surrender

      public void Surrender() throws Exception
      Allows a player to surrender during the game and performs the necessary actions to update their status and remove them from the game state. This method performs the following operations: 1. Sets the player's state to blocked, preventing further actions. 2. Removes the player from their current position on the flight board. 3. Notifies the game's event system to remove the player from the flight board using their username.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the surrender process.

    • getPlayerId

      public int getPlayerId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the player.
      Returns:
      the player's unique ID as an integer.

    • setMyShip

      public void setMyShip(ShipBoard myShipBOARD)
      Assigns a new ShipBoard object to the Player's ship.
      Parameters:
      myShipBOARD - the ShipBoard object to be assigned as the player's ship

    • getPositionOnBoard

      public int getPositionOnBoard()
      Retrieves the player's current position on the board.
      Returns:
      the player's position on the board as an integer

    • getPlayerScore

      public float getPlayerScore()
      Retrieves the current score of the player.
      Returns:
      the player's score as a floating-point value

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername()
      Retrieves the username of the player.
      Returns:
      the username of the player as a String

    • getNumFullRounds

      public int getNumFullRounds()
      Retrieves the number of full rounds completed by the player.
      Returns:
      the number of full rounds completed by the player

    • getColour

      public Ship_Colour getColour()
      Retrieves the color of the player's ship.
      Returns:
      the color of the ship as a value of the Ship_Colour enumeration

    • isBlocked

      public boolean isBlocked()
      Checks if the player is currently blocked from performing actions.
      Returns:
      true if the player is blocked, false otherwise.

    • getMyShip

      public ShipBoard getMyShip()
      Retrieves the ship associated with the player.
      Returns:
      the player's ship as a ShipBoard instance

    • hasSomethingInHand

      public boolean hasSomethingInHand()
      Checks whether the player is currently holding something in their hand. The player could be holding either a tile or a little deck.
      Returns:
      true if the player has either a tile or a little deck in their hand, false otherwise.

    • setPlayerScore

      public void setPlayerScore(float playerScore)
      Updates the score of the player.
      Parameters:
      playerScore - the new score to be assigned to the player

    • setNumFullRounds

      public void setNumFullRounds(int numFullRounds)
      Sets the number of full rounds completed by the player.
      Parameters:
      numFullRounds - the number of full rounds to be set for the player

    • setBlocked

      public void setBlocked(boolean blocked)
      Sets the blocked status of the player.
      Parameters:
      blocked - a boolean value indicating whether the player is blocked (true) or unblocked (false)

    • setPlayerPosOnboard

      public void setPlayerPosOnboard(int playerPosOnboard)
      Updates the player's position on the game board.
      Parameters:
      playerPosOnboard - the new position of the player on the board. This must represent a valid position within the game's board boundaries.

    • depositLittleDeckPlayer

      public void depositLittleDeckPlayer() throws RuntimeException
      Deposits the "Little Deck" that the player currently has in hand. This method is utilized to remove the reference to the player's "Little Deck" and update the player's state to indicate that they no longer have a "Little Deck" in hand. It sets the `LittleDeckInHand` field to null and the `hasLittleDeckInHand` flag to false. If this operation is invoked without proper validation before calling, it might lead to unexpected behavior; for example, attempting to deposit when no "Little Deck" is held will not throw an exception but can signify a logical error in the flow of operations.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the deposit process encounters an unexpected issue

    • pickTilePlayer

      public void pickTilePlayer(SpaceShipTile tile) throws RuntimeException
      Allows the player to pick a tile if they do not already have one in hand. If the player already has a tile in hand, a message is printed, and no changes are made.
      Parameters:
      tile - the SpaceShipTile object the player attempts to pick up.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if any runtime exception occurs during the operation.

    • depositTilePlayer

      public void depositTilePlayer(SpaceShipTile tile) throws RuntimeException
      Deposits the tile currently held by the player if it matches the provided tile. If the player does not hold the specified tile, a message is displayed, and the operation fails.
      Parameters:
      tile - The SpaceShipTile object that the player intends to deposit. It must be the same as the tile currently held by the player.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an operational error occurs during the deposit process.

    • pickLittleDeck

      public Deck pickLittleDeck(int index) throws Exception
      Picks a specified little deck from the player's flight board based on its index. If the deck is already occupied, a "wrong input" event is triggered, and the method returns null. Otherwise, the deck is marked as being in the player's hand, and the method returns the deck.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the deck to be picked from the flight board
      Returns:
      the picked Deck instance if it is not occupied, or null if the deck is occupied
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the retrieval or processing of the deck

    • IsThereTilesNextToThis

      public boolean IsThereTilesNextToThis(int row, int col) throws RuntimeException
      Checks if there are any accessible tiles adjacent to the specified position on the ship's matrix. The method evaluates the tiles directly above, below, to the left, and to the right of the given position. If any of the adjacent tiles are not null and are not of type SSTTypes.Tile_NonAccesiblePlace, the method returns true.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the tile to check adjacency for
      col - the column index of the tile to check adjacency for
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one accessible tile adjacent to the specified position, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the operation

    • InsertTile

      public Boolean InsertTile(SpaceShipTile tile, int row, int column) throws Exception
      Attempts to insert a tile into the player's spaceship grid at the specified position. The tile can only be inserted if the player is holding that specific tile and the specified position is adjacent to at least one existing tile in the grid. If the conditions are not met, an appropriate message is printed, and the insertion fails.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile to be inserted into the spaceship grid.
      row - The row index where the tile is to be placed.
      column - The column index where the tile is to be placed.
      Returns:
      true if the tile is successfully inserted; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an unexpected error during insertion.

    • getThingInHand

      public Object getThingInHand()
      Retrieves the object currently held by the player. This can either be a deck or a tile, depending on the player's current state. If the player is not holding anything, null will be returned.
      Returns:
      the object currently in the player's hand, which may be a Deck if the player is holding a deck, a SpaceShipTile if holding a tile, or null if the player is not holding anything.
